segments.text: Ugh, the sink is spewing water all over; what a filthy waste.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman's ankle-deep in that puddle, drying dishes like it's no big deal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her apron's probably getting soaked soon, and she doesn't care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Water streaming down the cabinet doors— that's going to warp the wood.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Now the kids; boy's got his grubby hands in the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: On that unstable stool, dropping crumbs everywhere no doubt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl's hovering, palm out like a beggar for sweets.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: They're stealing cookies behind her back, making the whole place sticky.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The floor's slick with water; imagine the germs breeding there.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Sunlight from the clean garden window just highlights the indoor grime.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't believe no one's shutting off that faucet or supervising.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This kitchen's turning into a sopping, sugary nightmare.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stacked dishes will topple if anyone slips— total mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's all so unnecessarily gross and avoidable.
segments.speaker: PAR
